message.content:
Step 1: Identify the required items. To calculate the Total Asset Turnover Ratio, we use the formula:

  Total Asset Turnover Ratio = Total Revenue / Average Total Assets

Step 2: From the income statement, obtain Total Revenue. In this case, the “Main Business Revenue” is given as 7,099,920.95.

Step 3: Compute the Average Total Assets. Using the balance sheet:
  • Initial Total Assets = 13,000,000.00 (as of 2023-12-31)
  • Ending Total Assets = 14,879,933.86 (as of 2024-01-29)

  Average Total Assets = (Initial Total Assets + Ending Total Assets) / 2
    = (13,000,000.00 + 14,879,933.86) / 2
    = 27,879,933.86 / 2
    ≈ 13,939,966.93

Step 4: Calculate the Total Asset Turnover Ratio:
  Total Asset Turnover Ratio = 7,099,920.95 / 13,939,966.93
  ≈ 0.509 (which rounds to 0.51)

Step 5: Present the answer.

{
  "solution": {
    "Total Asset Turnover Ratio": "0.51"
  }
}
